channel.title: Need New Gadgets
channel.description:
So my tax return this year was big enough that I should be able to afford to buy some new gadgets, but I don't know what to buy...
I need an MP3 player that can store a few thousand songs recorded in WMA, and play them back in random. I don't want to pay a bundle. I don't need extras like online or video or any of that crap. I just need a music player for at the gym, and maybe plug into my car stereo if I ever get the wiring done...
I also need a satellite navigation system. Again, I don't need a lot of extras, I just need to be able to figure out where I am going from where I am. I have used my parent's Mio Move and hated it. Not buying another device from them ever. So I need something else. Again, not looking for top of the line, but something that works reliably.

item.title: Need New Gadgets
item.dc:creator: Fuskox
item.description:
jerry:

i think the iPhone is the closest you are gonna get if you want an mp3 player with navigation.

the fact that you can call with it is a plus too.

i wouldn’t recommend an iPhone for a phone, but for what TheeGoatPig asks for, i recommend it.

you can get iPhones pretty cheap now if you buy a 3G or 3GS… honestly, you don’t need iPhone 4…

[EDIT] maybe you don’t get an mp3 player with navigation, but maybe a GPS with mp3 player?

What the fuck are you doing? Android phones are much better devices than iphones. Also, you can get some older android phones quite cheap.

Read full topic

item.title: Need New Gadgets
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
buy an iPhone and get the TomTom app. i don’t think there are simple mp3 players with navigation.

also, just use FormatFactory to convert WMA to mp3, so you can add them via iTunes.

Read full topic

item.title: Need New Gadgets
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
The stereo in my car is USB ready, and the more expensive model hs a USB adapter in the center arm-holder-dealy. So I’d imagine it just needs a wire run from stereo to anywhere I wanted it, and a fitting for the USB port to not look like shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Need New Gadgets
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
I use a Garmin, they’re excellent. Don’t know anyone that has a TomTom.

What wiring do you need to sort out for your car? I’ve had 2 aftermarket stereos with mp3 input, never been more complicated than fitting any other stereo

Read full topic

item.title: Need New Gadgets
item.dc:creator: Vitriol
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Garmins are garbage compared to tomtoms. All Garmin does is recalculate, and the displays are fucking hideous.

I used to sell TomToms as well and my mother has one.

I still picked the Garmin. Better reliability and IMO better interface. We had more TomToms come back than we did Garmins (and the Garmins sold better) over the 4yrs that I was doing the RA’s for the store + the following 12mths that we were selling GPS. Garmin is also much better to deal with if something goes wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Need New Gadgets

TheeGoatPig:

So my tax return this year was big enough that I should be able to afford to buy some new gadgets, but I don’t know what to buy…

I need an MP3 player that can store a few thousand songs recorded in WMA, and play them back in random. I don’t want to pay a bundle. I don’t need extras like online or video or any of that crap. I just need a music player for at the gym, and maybe plug into my car stereo if I ever get the wiring done…
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=9336
There are some good recommendations in this thread.

I also need a satellite navigation system. Again, I don’t need a lot of extras, I just need to be able to figure out where I am going from where I am. I have used my parent’s Mio Move and hated it. Not buying another device from them ever. So I need something else. Again, not looking for top of the line, but something that works reliably.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cGU0kRRWy_w&feature=feedu

I don’t have old gadgets. That is why I need new ones.
